import { useState } from "react"; const Register = () => { const [user, setUser] = useState({ name: "", email: "", password: "", }) //we want to update this state down there vvv --- onchange event console.log("user: ",user) return ( <>

Register

setUser({...user, name: e.target.value})} //this is how we are updating the name /> setUser({...user, email: e.target.value})} /> setUser({...user, password: e.target.value})} />
) } export default Register;
